inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: karyotype study revealed 45X and confirmed the diagnosis of Turner syndrome

inclusion.criterion: treated with growth hormone for at least two years
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: She is treating with GH since 6 months ago without estrogen therapy to avoid menarche and reach the ideal height.

inclusion.criterion: patient and parent signing an inform consent in the mother tongue
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient and parent signing an inform consent in the mother tongue.

exclusion.criterion: patients receiving growth hormone for other reasons
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: children who began signs of puberty (Tanner 2 or higher)
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Her breast bulb were in stage 1 with no course hair in the pubic or axillary.

exclusion.criterion: patients who completed growth, closed epiphysis
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 12 year old girl with Turner syndrome, treated with GH for 6 months. She has short stature and delayed puberty.
